JobFullDesc: Azure Edge + Platform brings together Edge platforms, devices, and services to deliver Edge solutions, operating systems, and engineering systems. Driven by its customers’ needs, Azure Edge + Platform seeks to accelerate growth for Azure, E&D, and Microsoft’s customers worldwide.  The organization’s portfolio spans the Cloud Edge Stack, Azure Engineering Systems, Azure Media Services - for end-to-end media workflow and analytics - and Microsoft’s Operating Systems including the Azure Host OS and Windows. This portfolio impressively powers the world with more than one billion monthly active devices. Team Overview : Are you interested in shaping how Microsoft’s largest platforms and services perform all aspects of observability? Want to be a builder rather than user of the telemetry platform? Want to work on one of the most critical components that are used by all the products and services? If so, look no further!Microsoft’s business runs on the telemetry that we receive from the intelligent cloud and edge. Our team (Observability Platform) has the charter to deliver the core telemetry platform of choice for the company. Our telemetry systems are the lifeline of Office, Azure, Windows, Xbox, and the thousands of cloud services run by our customers. The team works on Data Collection, Control, Correlation/Distributed Tracing, Curation, Metrics, Health and System Intelligence.ResponsibilitiesYou will build mission critical C# SDK used by the largest of the organizations in the world to monitor their applications and services.You embrace open source software development and contribute to the OSS community. Your work covers distributed tracing, metrics, log processing and data reliability.Your customers will include the largest organizations inside Microsoft (including Azure, Office, Windows, etc.), as well as big customers who are using Azure Monitor.You are collaborative and work constructively across functions, groups to solve customer problems. You will contribute to a positive culture, where all members of the team can do their best work, creating an advantage out of our diverse set of backgrounds, styles and skill sets.QualificationsRequired Qualifications:  Qualified candidates Must Have Already Successfully Completed or Participated in Microsoft Leap Apprenticeship Program and worked in a software engineering environment. Current Microsoft Leap Apprenticeship Program Experience. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related math/engineering field.More than 2 years of programming experience writing code in C#.Experience in designing and implementing core components that requires good performance and reliability. Preferred Qualifications: Ability to drive technical investigations and prototyping in a fast-paced startup environment.Excellence in collaboration across teams within and outside the organization, driving and delivering on initiatives.Experience in open-source development is preferred. #AEPJobs #PPPJobsCloud Background check:  Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role.
